013package org.apache.juneau.http.header;
014
015import static java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.StringUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ClassUtils.*;
018import java.time.*;
019import java.util.*;
020import java.util.function.*;
021
022import org.apache.juneau.*;
023import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.http.annotation.*;
025
026/**
027 * Represents a parsed <l>Retry-After</l> HTTP response header.
028 *
029 * <p>
030 * If an entity is temporarily unavailable, this instructs the client to try again later.
031 * Value could be a specified period of time (in seconds) or a HTTP-date.
032 *
033 * <h5 class='figure'>Example</h5>
034 * <p class='bcode'>
035 *    Retry-After: 120
036 *    Retry-After: Fri, 07 Nov 2014 23:59:59 GMT
037 * </p>
038 *
039 * <h5 class='topic'>RFC2616 Specification</h5>
040 *
041 * The Retry-After response-header field can be used with a 503 (Service Unavailable) response to indicate how long the
042 * service is expected to be unavailable to the requesting client.
043 * This field MAY also be used with any 3xx (Redirection) response to indicate the minimum time the user-agent is asked
044 * wait before issuing the redirected request.
045 * The value of this field can be either an HTTP-date or an integer number of seconds (in decimal) after the time of the
046 * response.
047 *
048 * <p class='bcode'>
049 *    Retry-After  = "Retry-After" ":" ( HTTP-date | delta-seconds )
050 * </p>
051 *
052 * <p>
053 * Two examples of its use are
054 * <p class='bcode'>
055 *    Retry-After: Fri, 31 Dec 1999 23:59:59 GMT
056 *    Retry-After: 120
057 * </p>
058 *
059 * <p>
060 * In the latter example, the delay is 2 minutes.
061 *
062 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
063 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../../index.html#juneau-rest-common">juneau-rest-common</a>
064 *    <li class='extlink'><a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616.html">Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1</a>
065 * </ul>
066 *
067 * @serial exclude
068 */
069@Header("Retry-After")
070public class RetryAfter extends BasicDateHeader {
071
072   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
073   // Static
074   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
075
076   private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
077   private static final String NAME = "Retry-After";
078
079   /**
080    * Static creator.
081    *
082    * @param value
083    *    The header value.
084    *    <br>Must be an RFC-1123 formated string (e.g. <js>"Sat, 29 Oct 1994 19:43:31 GMT"</js>) or an integer.
085    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
086    * @return A new header bean, or <jk>null</jk> if the name is <jk>null</jk> or empty or the value is <jk>null</jk>.
087    */
088   public static RetryAfter of(String value) {
089      return value == null ? null : new RetryAfter(value);
090   }
091
092   /**
093    * Static creator.
094    *
095    * @param value
096    *    The header value.
097    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
098    * @return A new header bean, or <jk>null</jk> if the name is <jk>null</jk> or empty or the value is <jk>null</jk>.
099    */
100   public static RetryAfter of(ZonedDateTime value) {
101      return value == null ? null : new RetryAfter(value);
102   }
103
104   /**
105    * Static creator.
106    *
107    * @param value
108    *    The header value.
109    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
110    * @return A new header bean, or <jk>null</jk> if the name is <jk>null</jk> or empty or the value is <jk>null</jk>.
111    */
112   public static RetryAfter of(Integer value) {
113      return value == null ? null : new RetryAfter(value);
114   }
115
116   /**
117    * Static creator with delayed value.
118    *
119    * <p>
120    * Header value is re-evaluated on each call to {@link #getValue()}.
121    *
122    * @param value
123    *    The supplier of the header value.
124    *    <br>Supplier must supply either {@link Integer} or {@link ZonedDateTime} objects.
125    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
126    * @return A new header bean, or <jk>null</jk> if the name is <jk>null</jk> or empty or the value is <jk>null</jk>.
127    */
128   public static RetryAfter of(Supplier<?> value) {
129      return value == null ? null : new RetryAfter(value);
130   }
131
132   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
133   // Instance
134   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
135
136   private final Integer value;
137   private final Supplier<?> supplier;
138
139   /**
140    * Constructor.
141    *
142    * @param value
143    *    The header value.
144    *    <br>Must be an RFC-1123 formated string (e.g. <js>"Sat, 29 Oct 1994 19:43:31 GMT"</js>) or an integer.
145    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
146    */
147   public RetryAfter(String value) {
148      super(NAME, isNumeric(value) ? null : value);
149      this.value = isNumeric(value) ? Integer.parseInt(value) : null;
150      this.supplier = null;
151   }
152
153   /**
154    * Constructor.
155    *
156    * @param value
157    *    The header value.
158    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
159    */
160   public RetryAfter(ZonedDateTime value) {
161      super(NAME, value);
162      this.value = null;
163      this.supplier = null;
164   }
165
166   /**
167    * Constructor.
168    *
169    * @param value
170    *    The header value.
171    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
172    */
173   public RetryAfter(Integer value) {
174      super(NAME, (String)null);
175      this.value = value;
176      this.supplier = null;
177   }
178
179   /**
180    * Constructor with delayed value.
181    *
182    * <p>
183    * Header value is re-evaluated on each call to {@link #getValue()}.
184    *
185    * @param value
186    *    The supplier of the header value.
187    *    <br>Supplier must supply either {@link Integer} or {@link ZonedDateTime} objects.
188    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
189    */
190   public RetryAfter(Supplier<?> value) {
191      super(NAME, (String)null);
192      this.value = null;
193      this.supplier = value;
194   }
195
196   @Override /* Header */
197   public String getValue() {
198      if (supplier != null) {
199         Object o = supplier.get();
200         if (o == null)
201            return null;
202         if (o instanceof Integer) {
203            return o.toString();
204         } else if (o instanceof ZonedDateTime) {
205            return RFC_1123_DATE_TIME.format((ZonedDateTime)o);
206         }
207         throw new BasicRuntimeException("Invalid object type returned by supplier: {0}", className(o));
208      }
209      if (value != null)
210         return Utils.s(value);
211      return super.getValue();
212   }
213
214   /**
215    * Returns this header value as an integer.
216    *
217    * @return This header value as a integer, or an empty optional if value was <jk>null</jk> or not an integer.
218    */
219   public Optional<Integer> asInteger() {
220      if (supplier != null) {
221         Object o = supplier.get();
222         return Utils.opt(o instanceof Integer ? (Integer)o : null);
223      }
224      return Utils.opt(value);
225   }
226}
